to render unknown</hi>: paupertas quorum obscurat nomina, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 73 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna res cunctas ex lubidine magis, quam ex vero celebrat obscuratque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31812.8" n="E" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To suppress, hide, conceal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod obscurari non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to obscure, cause to be forgotten, render of no account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo lucri obscurabat periculi magnitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: obscurari, <hi rend="ital">to become obscure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of no account, to grow obsolete</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin dicit obscurari quaedam nec apparere, quia valde parva sint, nos quoque concedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis eorum memoria sensim obscurata est et evanuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 95</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 509</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurata vocabula,</quote> <trans><tr>obsolete</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obscurus: <entryFree id="n31813" type="main" key="obscu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obscūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sku, to cover, akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skeuh/, sku=tos, ku/tos</foreign>; cf.: scutum, cutis</etym>, <sense id="n31813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark, darksome, dusky, shady, obscure</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n31813.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: unde (Acherunte) animae excitantur obscurā umbrā, <hi rend="ital">in dark, shadowy forms</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec in obscurum coni conduxit acumen,</quote> <trans><tr>the obscure point of the cone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convalles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 229</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl>: aliae res obnoxiosae nocte in obscurā latent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16</bibl> (17), 10 (Trag. v. 341 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 420</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per occasum solis, jam obscurā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrugo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>black</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 145</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: funda, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">invisible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:193" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 193</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mamma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hidden, covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:52:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turbid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:758" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 758</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">obscūrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dim light, twilight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obscuro, advesperascente die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 7, 9</bibl></cit>; but commonly <hi rend="ital">the dark, darkness, obscurity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub obscurum noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>darkness visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">obscū-rum</orth>, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurum nimbosus dissidet aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 631</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31813.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, to the person who is in the dark, <hi rend="ital">darkling, unseen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibant obscuri solā sub nocte per umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurus in ulvā Delitui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31813.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31813.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">dark, obscure, indistinct, unintelligible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclitus ... Clarus ob obscuram linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl></cit>: valde Heraclitus obscurus (cf. the Gr. appellation of Heraclitus, <foreign lang="greek">o( skoteino/s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? poëta nemo, nemo physicus obscurus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurā de re tam lucida pango carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 933</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis esse laboro, Obscurus fio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperta Graiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurum et ignotum jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur hoc tam est obscurum atque caecum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo plebem Romanam obscurā spe et caecā expectatione haerere,</quote> <trans><tr>uncertain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 60</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre res obscurissimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 153</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae in obscuro positae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n31813.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., rhet. t. t.: obscurum genus causae, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">intricate, involved</hi>, <cb n="OBSE" /> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dusparakolou/qhton</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 15, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(causae privatae) sunt multo saepe obscuriores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31813.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not known, unknown, not recognized</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P Ilas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disguised, under another form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of rank and station, <hi rend="ital">obscure, ignoble, mean, low</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est obscura tua in me benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 70</bibl></cit>: Caesaris in barbaris erat nomen obscurius, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius humili atque obscuro loco natus,</quote> <trans><tr>of an obscure, ignoble family</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscuris orti majoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>from obscure ancestors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus an obscurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si nobilis obscurum se vocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:9" default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non obscurus professor et auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus haud obscuro loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obscuro vitam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam per obscurum transmittere,</quote> <trans><tr>in obscurity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe mandatum initio litis in obscuro est,</quote> <trans><tr>kept back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:84" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31813.7" n="C" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">close, secret, reserved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurus et astutus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 5</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">sin me astutum et occultum lubet fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque modestus Occupat obscuri speciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberium obscurum adversus alios, sibi uni incautum intectumque efficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurum odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura obscurior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-scūrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">darkly, obscurely</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n31813.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aut nihil superum aut obscure admodum cernimus, <hi rend="ital">very darkly</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31813.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31813.10" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">darkly, obscurely, indistinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:79" default="NO">4, 1, 79</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa dicta obscurius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurissime particulā uti, Cell. 17, 13, 5: non obscurissime dicere (opp. planissime),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:16:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31813.11" n="2" level="3"> Of birth, <hi rend="ital">obscurely, ignobly, meanly</hi> (perh. only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obscure natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurissime natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31813.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Covertly, closely, secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum obscure serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacite obscureque perire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non obscure ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:54" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 54</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri sunt obscurius iniqui,</quote> <trans><tr>more secretly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertere aliquid de publico quam obscurissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obscus: <entryFree id="n31814" type="main" key="Obscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Obscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Osci.</entryFree>
obsecratio: <entryFree id="n31815" type="main" key="obse^cra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obsecro</etym>. <sense id="n31815.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a beseeching, imploring, supplication, entreaty</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">prece et obsecratione humili uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <trans><tr>addressed to the judges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percipe obsecrationem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:142:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 142, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit ad Deum pro illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31815.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31815.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An asseveration, protestation</hi>, accompanied by an invocation of the gods or of religious things, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/hsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 105</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 2, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31815.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A public prayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecrationem indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsecrator: <entryFree id="n31816" type="main" key="obse^cra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who entreats, a suppliant</hi>, Ven. Fort. Vit. Ger. 6.</sense></entryFree>
obsecro: <entryFree id="n31817" type="main" key="obse^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sĕcro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">op-sĕcro</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (separate, ob vos sacro, for vos obsecro, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=190" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 190</bibl>, Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sacro</etym>, qs. to ask on religious grounds (ob sacrum), i. e. <sense id="n31817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beseech, entreat, implore, supplicate, conjure</hi>: obsecrare est opem a sacris petere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=183" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 183</bibl> Müll. (class.; syn.: obtestor, precor, supplico).—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus alma, ambae te obsecramus, Nos in custodiam tuam ut recipias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsum quam ejus me opsecravisset pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum oraret atque obsecraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te obsecrat obtestaturque per senectutem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>conjures you</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 147</bibl>: cum precibus me obsecraret, Marcell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multis lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll.: pro di immortales, obsecro vostram fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 30</bibl>; cf. in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n31817.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With a double <case>acc.</case> (of the pers. and thing): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque te hoc obsecrat, ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31817.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relative</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intentional clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut huc reveniat obsecrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater, obsecro, ut mihi ignoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: te ut omnia perscribas, Cic. <cb n="OBSE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:11:1:1" default="NO">11, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31817.3" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus certis precationibus obsecrasse summos magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassus multis precibus, paene etiam lacrimis obsecrabat, implerem meum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,018:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Philem. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31817.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in colloq. lang., obsecro. </sense><sense id="n31817.5" n="A" level="2"> As an expression of deprecation, <hi rend="ital">I beseech you, I cry you mercy, for Heaven's sake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam fidem obsecro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periimus! Obsecro hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Prodi, male conciliate. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Obsecro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31817.6" n="B" level="2"> As a mere polite expression of entreaty, for the most part as an interjection, <hi rend="ital">I beseech you, pray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illic, opsecro, tam diu restitisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic obsecro hercle serio quod te rogem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro, an is est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attica mea, obsecro te, quid agit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed obsecro te, ita venusta habeantur ista, non ut vincula virorum sint, sed, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>but I beseech you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:36" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obsecundanter: <entryFree id="n31818" type="main" key="obse^cundanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcundanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. obsecundo <sense id="n31818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obsecundatio: <entryFree id="n31819" type="main" key="obse^cunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obsecundo</etym>, <sense id="n31819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compliance, obsequiousness</hi> (post-class.): servilis obsecundatio, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 92.</sense></entryFree>
obsecundator: <entryFree id="n31820" type="main" key="obse^cunda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcundātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi> (post-class.): sacrorum scriniorum, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 3.</sense></entryFree>
obsecundo: <entryFree id="n31821" type="main" key="obse^cundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sĕcundo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n31821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be compliant, show obedience; to comply with, humor, fall in with, follow implicitly, obey</hi> a pers. or thing (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: morigeror, obsequor, oboedio): obsecundare in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 37</bibl>: ut ejus semper voluntatibus socii obtemperarint, hostes oboedierint, venti tempestatesque obsecundarint, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecundando mollire impetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul capite atque umeris sensim ad id, quo manus feratur, obsecundantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 92</bibl></cit>; M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:35" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 35</bibl> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcundanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in compliance with, according to</hi> a thing: obsecundanter naturae vivere, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 26</bibl> (obsequenter, Non.).</sense></entryFree>
obsecutio: <entryFree id="n31822" type="main" key="obse^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquūtĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obsequor</etym>, <sense id="n31822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compliance, obedience</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">inviolabili obsecutione servare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntariae obsecutionis assensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsecutor: <entryFree id="n31823" type="main" key="obse^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquūtor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obeyer, keeper, observer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsecutores legis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obseptus: <entryFree id="n31824" type="main" key="obseptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-septus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obsaepio.</entryFree>
obsequela: <entryFree id="n31825" type="main" key="obse^que_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sĕquēla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obsequor</etym>, <sense id="n31825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compliance, complaisance, obsequiousness</hi>: obsequela obsequium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll. (ante-class. and in Sall.): neque erat tuae benignitatis atque obsequellae, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 63 and 210 Rib.); Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 3</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 257 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsequelam facere (alicui),</quote> <trans><tr>to show complaisance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit> (Fleck. obsequentiam): qui regi per obsequelam orationis cari erant, <hi rend="ital">through obsequiousness in speaking</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">because they spoke as he liked</hi>, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 33</bibl> (Hist. 2, 49 Dietsch).</sense></entryFree>
obsequens: <entryFree id="n31826" type="main" key="obse^quens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obsequor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31827" type="main" key="Obse^quens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Obsĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. IVLIVS OBSEQVENS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 824, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsequenter: <entryFree id="n31828" type="main" key="obse^quenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. obsequor, <sense id="n31828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
obsequentia: <entryFree id="n31829" type="main" key="obse^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. obsequens</etym>, <sense id="n31829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compliance, complaisance, obsequiousness</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): omnes parentes liberis suis facient obsequentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia obsequentia reliquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 29, 4</bibl></cit>; v. obsequela.</sense></entryFree>
obsequiae: <entryFree id="n31830" type="gloss" key="obse^qui^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obsequor</etym>, for exsequiae, <sense id="n31830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">funeral rites, obsequies</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 702</bibl>, n. 235 (Burm. and Meyer read exsequias).</sense></entryFree>
obsequialis: <entryFree id="n31831" type="main" key="obse^qui^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obsequium</etym>, <sense id="n31831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complying, yielding, complaisant</hi> (late Lat.): amor, Ven. Carm. 6, 7, 274.</sense></entryFree>
obsequibilis: <entryFree id="n31832" type="main" key="obse^qui^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obsequor</etym>, <sense id="n31832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">com</hi> <pb n="1242" /> <cb n="OBSE" /> <hi rend="ital">plying, yielding, complaisant</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obsequiosus: <entryFree id="n31833" type="main" key="obse^qui^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obsequium</etym>, <sense id="n31833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complying, complaisant, obsequious</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsequium: <entryFree id="n31834" type="main" key="obse^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sĕquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obsequor</etym>. <sense id="n31834.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">compliance, yieldingness, complaisance, indulgence</hi> (class.; syn.: indulgentia, obsequentia): prosequium a prosequendo, obsequium ab obsequendo dicuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium amicos, veritas odium parit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium atque patientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium et comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gluttony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo sumere,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow the bent of one's inclinations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obsequio uxoris,</quote> <trans><tr>in the service of his wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">flectitur obsequio curvatus ab arbore ramus,</quote> <trans><tr>by yielding, by its pliancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 179</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: omnia ei obsequia polliceor, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31834.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31834.2" n="A" level="2"> Compliance in love, <hi rend="ital">yielding, consent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:25" default="NO">10, 1, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31834.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Obedience, allegiance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>towards them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad obsequium redigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to subjugate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla colonia vestra erit, quae nos obsequio erga vos fideque superet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium in regem retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit> (43) <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 13, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 9</bibl>: jurare in obsequium alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to swear obedience</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allegiance to one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium erga aliquem exuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsequor: <entryFree id="n31835" type="main" key="obse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus</itype> (quutus), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <sense id="n31835.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to accommodate one's self to the will of</hi> a person; <hi rend="ital">to comply with, yield to, gratify, humor, submit to;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat. of the pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: morigeror, obtempero, pareo, oboedio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum huic obsecutus sis, illi est repugnandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 54, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntati alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:343" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 343</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31835.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the thing</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et id ego percupio obsequi gnato meo,</quote> <trans><tr>in this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31835.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31835.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To yield to, give one's self up to, indulge in</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2</bibl></cit>: fortunae, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est lubido homini suo animo opsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow one's inclinations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31835.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to be yielding, pliant, ductile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes regulare malleis obsequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo amori obsecutum illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit> (v. Lachm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 304</bibl>).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕ-quens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (separate, vin' tu te mihi ob esse sequentem an nevis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 39</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n31835.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">yielding, compliant, obsequious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opsequens oboediensque est mori atque inperiis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus obsequentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 50:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 50, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae mortalium obsequentissimam esse Italiam,</quote> <trans><tr>amenable, susceptible of culture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 291" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 291</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31835.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., an appellation of the gods, <hi rend="ital">favorable, indulgent, gracious, propitious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam atque obsequentem deam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, of Fortuna: Quem te deum autem nominem? <hi rend="ital">Leo.</hi> Fortunam atque obsequentem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1750</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1751</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">compliantly, obsequiously</hi> (perh. not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec a collegā obsequenter facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit in contubernio aviae severissime, et tamen obsequentissime,</quote> <trans><tr>entirely according to her wishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsequutio: <entryFree id="n31836" type="main" key="obse^quu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕquūtĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ūtor</orth>, v. obsecutio, -cutor.</entryFree>
obsero: <entryFree id="n31837" type="main" key="obse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-sera</etym>, <sense id="n31837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bolt, bar, fasten</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shut up</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: claudo, oppilo, obstruo). </sense><sense id="n31837.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores (opp. aperire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellam liminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:11:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31837.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:53" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 53</bibl></cit>: palatum<cb n="OBSE" />  (for os), i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be silent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores amicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31838" type="main" key="obse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ops-</orth>), <itype>sēvi, sĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n31838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf. sync.</hi> obsesse for obsevisse, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 27</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31838.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31838.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 129</bibl></cit>. —Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnos,</quote> <trans><tr>to give a good drubbing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31838.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31838.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">saepimentum virgultis aut spinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: terram frugibus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31838.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cover over, fill with;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">perf. pass. part., covered over, filled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia arbustis obsita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca obsita virgultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsita pomis Rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video aegrum pannis annisque obsitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsitus illuvie ac squalore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis obsita squalore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati ... obsiti squalore et sordibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis obsita frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes nivibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër pallore,</quote> <trans><tr>darkened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 627</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies nube obsitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsitus aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Io jam setis obsita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga (marinae beluae) obsita conchis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 724</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31838.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tun' is es, qui in me aerumnam obsevisti,</quote> <trans><tr>hast brought upon me, occasioned me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">em istic oportet opseri mores malos, si in opserendo possint interfieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
observabilis: <entryFree id="n31839" type="main" key="observa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>observo</etym>, <sense id="n31839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">remarkable, observable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientia,</quote> <trans><tr>remarkable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox ista est observabilis Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
observans: <entryFree id="n31840" type="main" key="observans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from observo.</entryFree>
observanter: <entryFree id="n31841" type="main" key="observanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. observo, <sense id="n31841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
observantia: <entryFree id="n31842" type="main" key="observanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>observo</etym>, <sense id="n31842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remarking, noting, regard, observance</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31842.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum observantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1063" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1063</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31842.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31842.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Observance, attention, respect, regard, reverence</hi> shown to another: <cit><quote lang="la">observantia est, per quam aetate, aut sapientiā, aut honore, aut aliquā dignitate antecedentes veremur et colimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia observantiamque dilexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos observantiā, rem parsimoniā retinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observantia, quā me colit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem pro libertis adversus patronos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31842.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An obedient observance; a keeping, following, performing</hi> of laws, customs, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">prisci moris observantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31842.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An observance of religious duties, divine worship, religion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides Catholicae observantiae, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 12, § 54: religio et observantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
observate: <entryFree id="n31843" type="main" key="observa_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. observo, <sense id="n31843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
observatio: <entryFree id="n31844" type="main" key="observa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>observo</etym>, <sense id="n31844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching, observing, observance</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n31844.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">observationi operam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—As a gift or faculty, <hi rend="ital">the power of observation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 284</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31844.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31844.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An office, duty, service</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei sui et expiationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 12, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">in observationibus sicut fas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Macc. 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31844.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An observation, remark; a precept, rule</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare observationes aliquas coquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis antiqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31844.5" n="C" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">circumspection, care, exactness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa erat observatio in bello movendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31844.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Regard, respect, esteem, reverence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">religionibus suam observationem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christianitatis, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 112: divina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:12:1:104" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 1, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31844.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Display, outward show</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non venit regnum Dei cum observatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 17, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31844.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Observance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
observator: <entryFree id="n31845" type="main" key="observa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watcher, observer</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo observator, nemo castigator assistet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observator et custos bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 41:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: Catholicae legis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who obeys it</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 1.</sense></entryFree>
observatrix: <entryFree id="n31846" type="main" key="observa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>observator</etym>, <sense id="n31846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that observes, an observer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fides observatrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
observatus: <entryFree id="n31847" type="main" key="observa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>observo</etym>, <sense id="n31847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">observation</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex observatu dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="OBSE" /></sense></entryFree>
observito: <entryFree id="n31848" type="main" key="observi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">observĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>observo</etym>, <sense id="n31848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to watch carefully, to note, observe</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Assyrii.. trajectiones motusque stellarum observitaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Deo Socr. p. 52, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 17</bibl>: caerimonias, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
observo: <entryFree id="n31849" type="main" key="observo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-servo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n31849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> observasso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 57</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31849.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to watch, note, heed, observe</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to take notice of, pay attention to</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: animadverto, attendo): ne me observare possis, quid rerum geram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ille faciat, ne id observes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch for, seek to catch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus observavit, dum dormitarent canes,</quote> <trans><tr>watched, waited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupationem alicujus, et aucupari tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch in order to take advantage of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si iniquitates observaveris, Domine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:129:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 129, 3</bibl></cit>: tempus epistulae alicui reddendae, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wait for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et insidiari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be on the watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>: observavit sedulo, ut praetor indiceret, etc., <hi rend="ital">took care that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl>.—So <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observatum est, ne quotiens introiret urbem, supplicium de quoquam sumeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observans Acerroniae necem,</quote> <trans><tr>observing, perceiving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam poëta sensit, scripturam suam Ab iniquis observari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be scrutinized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep a close watch over one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:283" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 283</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31849.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31849.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To watch, guard, keep</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 513</bibl></cit>: draconem, auriferam obtutu observantem arborem, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 223" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31849.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To observe, respect, regard, attend to, heed, keep, comply with</hi> a law, precept, recommendation, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoriam animadversionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptum diligentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:78" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centesimas,</quote> <trans><tr>to adhere to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend to, regard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem concilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep in the ranks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ab omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31849.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pay attention</hi> or <hi rend="ital">respect to; to respect, regard, esteem, honor</hi> one (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">veneror, revereor): tribules suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me, ut alterum patrem, et observat, et diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et colere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem perofficiose et amanter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimus et nobis observandus vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. p. 4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. p. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31849.6" n="D" level="2"> Observare se a quā re = se abstinere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 13, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31849.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To observe, notice, perceive</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Amasa non observavit gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 20, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31849.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-servans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31849.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Watchful, regardful, observant.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observantior aequi Fit populus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 296</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observantissimus omnium officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11, 1</bibl>: observantissima lex suorum itinerum, App. de Mundo, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n31849.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Attentive, respectful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo tui observans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 77</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">observantissimus mei homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">observanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully, sedulously</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observantius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 79</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid observantissime vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31849.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Reverentially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad precandum accedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31849.12" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">observātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., observantly, carefully, perspicaciously</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">observate curioseque animadvertit M. Tullius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obses: <entryFree id="n31850" type="main" key="obses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obses</orth> (old orthogr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">opses</orth>, in the first Epit. of the Scipios; <sense id="n31850.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; Inscr. Spec. Epigr. p. 5, 11 Jahn), ĭdis (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> obsidium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 97</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ob-sedeo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n31850.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hostage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">OPSIDES ABDOVCIT, first Epit. of the Scipios: ut obsides accipere, non dare consueverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides alicui imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinere aliquem obsidem,</quote> <trans><tr>as a hostage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tamen acceptā poterat deponere bellum Obside,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides, qui Porsenae mittebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 13, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to exchange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="1243" /> <cb n="OBSI" /> </sense><sense id="n31850.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a surety, security, bail, pledge</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsor, vindex, vas, praes): Phocion se ejus rei obsidem fore, pollicitus est,</quote> <trans><tr>to be surety, to answer for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere aliquem obsidem nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: dare obsides, with a foll. <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., to give a surety</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guarantee</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum modo oratoribus Metellus obsides non dedit, se nullā in re Verri similem futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:53:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 53, § 124</bibl></cit>.—Also of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">habemus a C. Caesare sententiam tamquam obsidem perpetuae in rem publicam voluntatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidem enim se animum ejus habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsessio: <entryFree id="n31851" type="main" key="obsessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obsideo</etym>, <sense id="n31851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blocking up, besieging, encompassing, a blockade</hi> of a place (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsessio templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsessionem alicuius omittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
obsessor: <entryFree id="n31852" type="main" key="obsessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sits, stays, abides</hi> in a place; <hi rend="ital">a frequenter, haunter</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31852.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.
