amoliri,</quote> <trans><tr>hinderances, obstructions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstragulum: <entryFree id="n31912" type="main" key="obstra_gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrāgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obsterno</etym>, <sense id="n31912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strap, lace, latchet</hi>, that fastened the sandal to the foot: <cit><quote lang="la">crepidarum obstragulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrangulatus: <entryFree id="n31913" type="main" key="obstrangu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrangŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the obsol. obstrangulo [ob-strangulo], <sense id="n31913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strangled;</hi> trop. (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obstrangulata mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstreperus: <entryFree id="n31914" type="main" key="obstre^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrĕpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obstrepo</etym>, <sense id="n31914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clamorous, chirping</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 349, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrepitaculum: <entryFree id="n31915" type="main" key="obstre^pi^ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrĕpĭtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obstrepito</etym>, <sense id="n31915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clamor against, an outcry</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrepito: <entryFree id="n31916" type="main" key="obstre^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrĕpĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n31916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [obstrepo], <hi rend="ital">to sound against, to interrupt by noise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). obstrepitant lamenta choris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 355</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrepo: <entryFree id="n31917" type="main" key="obstre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-strĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n31917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31917.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31917.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to make a noise against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at; to roar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resound at; to resound, sound</hi>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marisque Baiis obstrepentis urges Submovere litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotis Obstrepit Oceanus Britannis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque nativis obstrepit arbor aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">si, intrante te, clamor, et plausus, et pantomimica ornamenta obstrepuerint, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontesque lymphis obstrepunt manantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tympana ... raucis Obstrepuere sonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrula per ramos avis obstrepit,</quote> <trans><tr>sings aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 454" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam genus totum obstrepit,</quote> <trans><tr>makes loud lament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 758" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 758</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers., there is a noise, a noise arises</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non statim, si quid obstrepet, abiciendi codices erunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>if there shall be a noise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:30:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 30, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31917.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bawl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shout against; to clamor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out against</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31917.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarius obstrepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certatim alter alteri obstrepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quodammodo ipsi sibi in dicendo obstrepere videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviro obstrepitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 49, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To annoy, molest, be troublesome to</hi>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res fecit, ut tibi litteris obstrepere non auderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To impede</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hinder; to prove an obstacle, hinderance</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">injury to</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31917.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrectare Pompeium, actisque ejus obstrepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remove parentem, ne tuae laudi obstrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1030" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1030</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mhil sensere (Poeni), obstrepente pluviā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 56, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut accipiatur circumjecto candore lux, et, temperato repercussu, non obstrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl></cit>: scelerati, <cb n="OBST" /> conscientiā obstrepente, condormire non possunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed clausae sunt aures, obstrepente irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.12" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To cry out against, blame</hi>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic definitioni ita obstrepunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to clamor against; to oppose, disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen ejus modi, etiam cum leguntur, obstrepi clamore militum videntur, et tubarum sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in Cn. Pompeium congesta sunt: hinc assensione favoris, illinc fremitu invidiae, litterarum monumentis obstrepuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are perverted, distorted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:15:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31917.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill with noise, cause to resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretus ab omni voce locus, si non opstreperetur aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrictus: <entryFree id="n31918" type="main" key="obstrictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obstringo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31919" type="greek" key="obstrictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obstringo</etym>, <sense id="n31919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding, clasping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendat flammam ipso obstrictu (al. affrictu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrigillator: <entryFree id="n31920" type="main" key="obstri^gilla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrĭgillātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obstrigillo</etym>, <sense id="n31920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opposer, blamer</hi> (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrigillo: <entryFree id="n31921" type="main" key="obstri^gillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrĭgillo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">obstringillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obstringo</etym>, <sense id="n31921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hinder, oppose, impede</hi> (ante-class.): restitant, occurrunt, obstant, obstringillant, obigitant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocenti, Varr. ib.: multa (al. obsigillant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrigillus: <entryFree id="n31922" type="gloss" key="obstri^gillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrĭgillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoe-sole, sandal</hi>, fastened to the foot by straps, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obstringo: <entryFree id="n31923" type="main" key="obstringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-stringo</orth>, <itype>strinxi, strictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31923.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about; to bind, tie</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fasten up</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">follem obstringit ob gulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom ego Amphitruonem collo hinc obstricto traham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervice obstrictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros aratro,</quote> <trans><tr>to yoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:602" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 602</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31923.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind, bind up, close up by binding</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31923.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31923.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31923.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To shut in, confine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31923.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To hold together by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurea vestis ingentibus obstricta gemmis,</quote> <trans><tr>in which precious stones were the fastenings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31923.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind, tie, fetter, hamper; to oblige, lay under obligation</hi> (the class. signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: obligo, devincio): donis aliquem obstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem jurejurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aere alieno,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring into debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind by an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 30, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam plurimas civitates suo sibi beneficio habere obstrictas volebat,</quote> <trans><tr>bound, under obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticum officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se tot sceleribus obstrinxerit,</quote> <trans><tr>has been guilty of so many crimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se parricidio,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit, perpetrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se perjurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conscientiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind by privity, by participation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: obstringi conscientiā tanti sceleris, ne, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be hindered by the sense of so great a crime, from</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem societate scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem suam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to pledge one's word, to promise positively</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 14</bibl>.—Mid.: qui alienum ... sustulit, furti obstringitur, <hi rend="ital">makes himself guilty, becomes guilty</hi>, Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eidem sceleri obstrictus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> according to III., <hi rend="ital">bound, obliged</hi>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstrictior Debitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Nat. Felic. 9, 145</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrictē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv.; comp.</hi>: obstrictius, <hi rend="ital">more stringently</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 24.</sense></entryFree>
obstructio: <entryFree id="n31924" type="main" key="obstructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-structĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obstruo</etym>, <sense id="n31924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a building before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against, a closing up by building, a blocking up</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31924.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31924.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an obstruction, a barrier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec obstructio non diuturna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstructus: <entryFree id="n31925" type="main" key="obstructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obstruo.</entryFree>
obstrudo: <entryFree id="n31926" type="main" key="obstru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. obtrudo.</entryFree>
obstrudulentus: <entryFree id="n31927" type="hapax" key="obstru_dulentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrūdulentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>obtrudo</etym>, <sense id="n31927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be swallowed down</hi>: obstrudulenti da aliquid, quo pectam sedens, Titin. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=193" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 193</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 134 Rib.), v. obtrudo.</sense></entryFree>
obstruo: <entryFree id="n31928" type="main" key="obstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-strŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opstr-</orth>), <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to build before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against; to build, block</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wall up; to stop up, barricade, render</hi> <cb n="OBSU" /> <hi rend="ital">impassable</hi> (class.; cf. obsaepio, claudo, oppilo). </sense><sense id="n31928.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">validum pro diruto obstruentes murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem castrorum auxiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to build before so as to obstruct the light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstructae fenestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FENESTRAS OPSTRVITO, Lex. Puteol. ap. Grut. 207, 2: luminibus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44</bibl></cit>: jus luminum obstruendorum redimere, <hi rend="ital">to purchase permission of a neighbor to build so as to obstruct his light</hi>, Inscr. Guarin. Comment. in Vet. Monument. 1, p. 64: <cit><quote lang="la">portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: valvas aedis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum venas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <trans><tr>placed in the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aures morbus obstruxit,</quote> <trans><tr>has stopped up, made deaf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os obstruere,</quote> <trans><tr>to close the mouth, to make silent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:62:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 62, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31928.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stop up, hinder, impede, obstruct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis luminibus obstruxit haec posteriorum quasi exaggerata altius oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>was a hinderance to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri deus obstruit aures,</quote> <trans><tr>stops, renders deaf, inexorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugia improborum,</quote> <trans><tr>shuts off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 28, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitionem difficultatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to impede, obstruct</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31928.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Intr., to be in the way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si officiens signis mons obstruet altus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstrusus: <entryFree id="n31929" type="spur" key="obstru_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obs-trūsus</orth>, false read. for abstrusus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 4</bibl>.</entryFree>
obstupefacio: <entryFree id="n31930" type="main" key="obstu^pe^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-stŭpĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">obstŭpĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to astonish, amaze, astound, stupefy; to render senseless, deprive of feeling, benumb</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum timidum obstupefecit pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso miraculo audaciae obstupefecit hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi metus maerorem obstupefaceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstupefactis hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstupefacti hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstupefactis nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>, ext. 6.</sense></entryFree>
obstupefactus: <entryFree id="n31931" type="main" key="obstu^pe^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstŭpĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obstupefacio.</entryFree>
obstupefio: <entryFree id="n31932" type="main" key="obstu^pe^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstŭpĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fieri</itype>, v. obstupefacio.</entryFree>
obstupendus: <entryFree id="n31933" type="main" key="obstu^pendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-stŭpendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ob-stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n31933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">astounding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obstupesco: <entryFree id="n31934" type="main" key="obstu^pesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-stŭpesco</orth>, v. obstipesco.</entryFree>
obstupidus: <entryFree id="n31935" type="main" key="obstu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-stŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., amazed, confounded, beside one's self, senseless, stupefied</hi> (ante- and post-class.): hiat sollicita, studio obstupida, suspenso animo civitas, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 429, 7</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 68 Rib. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid astitisti obstupida?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitus et obstupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consternatus ac prorsus obstupidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 114, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obstupratus: <entryFree id="n31936" type="main" key="obstu_^pra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obstū^prātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obsol. obstupro [ob-stupro], <sense id="n31936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defiled, dishonored</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obsufflo: <entryFree id="n31937" type="hapax" key="obsufflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sufflo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n31937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to blow against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 7</bibl></sense></entryFree>
obsum: <entryFree id="n31938" type="main" key="obsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sum</orth>, <itype>obfui or offui, obesse</itype> (old form of <sense id="n31938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> obescet, oberit vel aderit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=188" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 188</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">v. n., to be against, be prejudicial to; to hinder, hurt, injure;</hi> opp. to prodesse (cf.: officio, noceo, injuriam facio; class.): <hi rend="ital">Ty.</hi> Nunc falsa prosunt. <hi rend="ital">Heg.</hi> At tibi oberunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; cf.: men obesse, illos prodesse, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 84 Vahl.); and: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (pudor) non modo non obesset ejus orationi, sed etiam probitatis commendatione prodesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 122</bibl></cit>: subicimus id. quod nobis adjumento futurum sit, aut offuturum illis e contrario. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 23, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsunt auctoribus artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne prodigus obsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 89</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, dum degrandinat, obsit Agresti fano supposuisse pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:755" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil obest dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsuo: <entryFree id="n31939" type="main" key="obsu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-sŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31939.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sew on</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">obsutum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:578" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 578</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31939.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sew up, sew together; to stop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nares, et spiritus oris obsuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sporta auri obsuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsuta lectica,</quote> <trans><tr>the curtains of which are sewed together all around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obsurdatus: <entryFree id="n31940" type="main" key="obsurda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsurdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ob-surdus</etym>, <sense id="n31940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rendered deaf</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 57:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 57, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obsurdefacio: <entryFree id="n31941" type="main" key="obsurde^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsurdĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-surdusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n31941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render deaf</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. 33, 6. <pb n="1246" /> <cb n="OBTE" /></sense></entryFree>
obsurdesco: <entryFree id="n31942" type="main" key="obsurdesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-surdesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become deaf</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n31942.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sonitu oppletae aures hominum obsurduerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 19</bibl></cit>: si sapiens excaecatur, obsurdescat, etc., Aug. Civ. Dei, 19, 4, 4.—</sense><sense id="n31942.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be deaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to give ear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsurdescimus nescio quo modo, nec ea, quae ab eā (naturā) monemur, audimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 88</bibl></cit>: obsurduerunt aures hominum ad tam salutaria praecepta, Ambros. de Tobia, 3, 9.</sense></entryFree>
obsutus: <entryFree id="n31943" type="main" key="obsu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obsūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obsuo.</entryFree>
obt: <entryFree id="n31944" type="main" key="obt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obt-</orth> in compounds. In some MSS. and editions <orth extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>.</entryFree>
obtaedesco: <entryFree id="n31945" type="main" key="obtaedesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-taedesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disgust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo optaedescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 52</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
obtectus: <entryFree id="n31946" type="main" key="obtectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obtego</etym>, <sense id="n31946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 4, 65.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n31947" type="main" key="obtectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obtego.</entryFree>
obtego: <entryFree id="n31948" type="main" key="obte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĕgo</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">obtĭgo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 8</bibl>), <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n31948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover up</hi> (for protection or concealment) (syn.: obtendo, velo, celo; class.). </sense><sense id="n31948.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuper lingua bubula obtegito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectus perpluit meum, neque jam umquam obtigere possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus arboribus obtecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se servorum et libertorum corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os obtegendum, fauces velandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31948.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to veil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtegere errata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia multis virtutibus obtecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adulescentiae turpitudo obscuritate obtegatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera nuper reperta priscis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 33</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus audax, sui obtegens in alios criminator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31948.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To protect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre precibus meliorum obtectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtemperanter: <entryFree id="n31949" type="main" key="obtempe^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtempĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. obtempero <sense id="n31949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obtemperatio: <entryFree id="n31950" type="hapax" key="obtempe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtempĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtempero</etym>, <sense id="n31950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complying with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">submitting to; compliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obedience;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si justitia est obtemperatio scriptis legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtemperator: <entryFree id="n31951" type="main" key="obtempe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtempĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who obeys</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 134:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 134, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtempero: <entryFree id="n31952" type="main" key="obtempe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tempĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n31952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conform to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obey</hi> (cf.: oboedio, obsequor, pareo; class.). </sense><sense id="n31952.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te audi, tibi obtempera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui obtemperare et parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntati alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritati senatūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationi obtemperare debet gubernator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 6</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui obtemperet ipse sibi, et decretis suis pareat,</quote> <trans><tr>who conforms to his own precepts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi deos certo scio obtemperaturos magis,</quote> <trans><tr>they will regard you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31952.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id, quod ex verbis intellegi possit, obtemperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31952.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> (perh. only in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">non ego illi obtempero quod loquitur,</quote> <trans><tr>do not mind what he says</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 89</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31952.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: quominus eis optemperetur, Lex. Jul. Municip. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> ap. Haub. p. 133: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi esset obtemperatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obtempĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obediently</hi> (postAug.): se obtemperanter nobis accommodat, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 11</bibl> Mai.: annuit, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 112.</sense></entryFree>
obtendo: <entryFree id="n31953" type="main" key="obtendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31953.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place before</hi> (cf. obtego; not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n31953.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31953.2" n="1" level="3"> Proque viro nebulam et ventos obtendere inanes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudarium ante faciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtentā nocte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in dark night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 248</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31953.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis membrana obtenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannia Germaniae obtenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>lies over against Germany</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31953.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pretend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plead as an excuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris preces obtendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea Drusus cum arbitrium senatūs obtenderet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem corporis, aetatem liberūm, nubilem filiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae imbecillitati sanitatis appellationem obtendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: rationem<cb n="OBTE" />  turpitudini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui delictis suis excusationem carnis obtendet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid poterimus obtendere,</quote> <trans><tr>plead what excuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 44, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31953.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31953.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtendunt limina silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:248" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:228" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem nube atrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31953.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi velis quibusdam obtenditur uniuscujusque natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31953.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a cover for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellius curis luxum obtendebat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sought a refuge from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
obtenebratio: <entryFree id="n31954" type="main" key="obte^nebra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĕnebrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtenebro</etym>, <sense id="n31954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 5, 49.</sense></entryFree>
obtenebresco: <entryFree id="n31955" type="main" key="obte^nebresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĕnebresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow dark</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lux in tabernaculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtenebro: <entryFree id="n31956" type="main" key="obte^nebro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĕnebro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n31956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obtenebrabitur dies lucis (al. tenebrabitur),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mic. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtensus: <entryFree id="n31957" type="hapax" key="obtensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obtendo</etym>, for obtentus, <sense id="n31957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pretext</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Amic. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
obtentio: <entryFree id="n31958" type="main" key="obtenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id. II.</etym>, <sense id="n31958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veiling;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid obtentionibus allegoricis claudere,</quote> <trans><tr>by an allegorical dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtento: <entryFree id="n31959" type="spur" key="obtento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. for oblectabat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl>; v. Orell. and Baiter ad loc.</entryFree>
obtentus: <entryFree id="n31960" type="main" key="obtentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtentus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n31960.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from obtendo.—</sense><sense id="n31960.1" n="II" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from obtineo.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31961" type="main" key="obtentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obtendo</etym>. <sense id="n31961.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spreading</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">placing before</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n31961.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtentu togae, tamquam se amiciens, ne videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31961.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatio, species): obtentum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora reipublicae obtentui sumpta,</quote> <trans><tr>assumed as a pretext</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub obtentu liberationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:8:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: sub obtentu monituum deorum quaedam enuntiare, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 6.—</sense><sense id="n31961.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to obtendo, II.) <hi rend="ital">A covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia secundae res mire sunt vitiis optentui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera sunt, quae loquuntur poëtae, sed obtentu aliquo specieque velata,</quote> <trans><tr>disguise</tr>, <tr>allegorical dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non terror obtentui est,</quote> <trans><tr>a hinderance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Constant. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtero: <entryFree id="n31962" type="main" key="obte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n31962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi> obtrisset for obtrivisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 8</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.; perf.</hi> obterii, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 8, p. 278, 15</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31962.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">break to pieces</hi> (syn. obtundo; class.).—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in stabulo infantes grex boum obtereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustarum ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in angustiis portarum obtriti sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>crushed by the crowd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31962.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trample on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meaeque pugnae proeliares plurumae optritae jacent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem imperatoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem verbis,</quote> <trans><tr>to degrade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 645" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oed. 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi omne cadaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:260" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 260</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n31962.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes carbone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 8, p. 278, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtestatio: <entryFree id="n31963" type="main" key="obtesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-testātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtestor</etym>, <sense id="n31963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adjuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjuring; an engaging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi> to any thing <hi rend="ital">by calling God to witness</hi> (class.): obtestatio est, cum deus testis in meliorem partem vocatur: detestatio, cum in deteriorem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=184" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 184</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo illa tua obtestatio tibicinis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:48:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 48, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31963.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an earnest entreaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjuration</hi> (rare); in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae in preces obtestationesque versae,</quote> <trans><tr>supplications</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus ad infimas obtestationes procumbens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: quā obtestatione discedens, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtestatus: <entryFree id="n31964" type="main" key="obtesta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtestātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. obtestor. <cb n="OBTI" /></entryFree>
obtestor: <entryFree id="n31965" type="main" key="obtestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-testor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n31965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call as a witness</hi> to any thing; <hi rend="ital">to protest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assert</hi> by a person or thing (syn.: testor, obsecro, supplico; class.). </sense><sense id="n31965.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitudinem nostram tuamque in me benevolentiam obtestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm hominumque fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra regni, deos et hospitales mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam rempublicam agi obtestans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut militum se manibus aut suis moriturum obtestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31965.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to conjure by calling to witness; to entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ego haec genua te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes deos te obtestor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos obtestor atque obsecro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id sibi ne eripiatis, vos obtestatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsistens obtestansque deum et hominum fidem testabatur, nequiquam eos fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>. —With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud te ... Pro Latio obtestor, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 819</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">obtestātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">earnestly entreated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtestatus prece impensā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtestatā fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtexo: <entryFree id="n31966" type="main" key="obtexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-texo</orth>, <itype>xŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n31966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To weave to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">papilio fila araneosa alarum lanugine obtexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31966.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To weave over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to overspread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum obtexitur umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per nubes caelum aliud obtexens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculis obtexitur aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 1, 258</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusationes obtexere avaritiae suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol nubibus obtexitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obticentia: <entryFree id="n31967" type="main" key="obti^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obticeo</etym>, <sense id="n31967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudden break</hi> in the midst of a discourse, as a rhet. figure: <foreign lang="greek">*)aposiw/phsis</foreign>, quam Cicero reticentiam, Celsus obticentiam, nonnulli interruptionem appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obticeo: <entryFree id="n31968" type="hapax" key="obti^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>taceo</etym>, <sense id="n31968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be silent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obticesco: <entryFree id="n31969" type="main" key="obti^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtĭcesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>tĭcŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [obticeo], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be struck silent;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be silent</hi> (syn. obmutesco): <cit><quote lang="la">obticuit obticescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, amabo, opticuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc obticuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Umpfenb. and Fleck. obstipuisti): repente obticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prius obticuit quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 17, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: cetera obticuit, Lact. Ira Dei, 4, 13.</sense></entryFree>
obtigo: <entryFree id="n31970" type="main" key="obti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. obtego.</entryFree>
obtinentia: <entryFree id="n31971" type="main" key="obti^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtineo</etym>, <sense id="n31971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possession</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1163</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
obtineo: <entryFree id="n31972" type="main" key="obti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tĭnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>tĭnŭi, tentum, 2</itype> (old <sense id="n31972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> OPTENVI, fifth Epit. of the Scipios; <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> obtinerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 154</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>teneo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n31972.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n31972.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtine aures, amabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31972.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess; to preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n31972.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: sancte Apollo, qui umbilicum certum terrarum obtines, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 201 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque domum tum obtinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis Galliam atque Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum imperio Hispaniam citeriorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to have as his province</tr>, <tr>to be governor in it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam et Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā insulā nummus nullus, me obtinente, erogabitur,</quote> <trans><tr>during my administration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: QVEI AERARIVM PROVINCIAM OBTINEBIT, <hi rend="ital">who will have the administration of the public treasure</hi>, Lex Thor. § 20 Rudorff. p. 168; <cit><quote lang="la">Lex de Scribis ap. Haubold, p. 85: necessitudinem cum publicanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:12:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 12, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam et famam,</quote> <trans><tr>to preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <trans><tr>to assert</tr>, <tr>maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem insequentem eadem caligo obtinuit,</quote> <trans><tr>occupied</tr>, <tr>took up</tr>, <tr>prevailed during</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (fama) plerosque obtinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proverbii locum obtinet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is become proverbial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis gravitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum deorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to be numbered among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:175" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 175</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl>: summam opinionem<pb n="1247" /> <cb n="OBTI" />  m scholis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be admired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmitudinem animi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exhibited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>would not yield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to persist in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">earumque artem et disciplinam obtineat colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31972.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">to assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possumus hoc teste ... quod dicimus, obtinere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas contrarias sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu pugnare in iis, quae obtinere non possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta apud turpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam (leges) an obtineri possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO">6, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod orator praecipue sibi obtinendum intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. proponendum); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si defecerint omnia, tum videndum erit, an obtineri possit, ne illud quidem recte factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:18" default="NO">2, 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31972.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To get possession of; to gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> something (syn.: assequor, adipiscor, impetro; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): quanta instrumenta habeat (homo) ad obtinendam adipiscendamque sapientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrare et obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malas causas semper obtinuit, in optimā concidit,</quote> <trans><tr>gained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus suum contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani si rem obtinuerint,</quote> <trans><tr>if they gained the victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85</bibl></cit>: voluimus quaedam; <cit><quote lang="la">obtenta non sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 27, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eum causam obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditu regis obtento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">melius est ut pugnemus contra eos in campestribus, et obtinebimus eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 20, 23</bibl></cit>; 20, 25; id. Judith, 1, 5.—</sense><sense id="n31972.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (cf. teneo, II.), <hi rend="ital">to maintain itself; to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod et plures tradidere auctores et fama obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: pro vero antea obtinebat, regna atque imperia Fortunam dono dare, Sall. Rep. Ordin. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ipsos quoque fuisse pastores obtinebit, quod? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
