R. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dissentirent, sententia plurium obtineret,</quote> <trans><tr>would prevail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod merito obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinuit (sc. consuetudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: quia de intercalando non obtinuerat, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his obtinuit, ut praeferretur candidato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinuit, ne reus fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtingo: <entryFree id="n31973" type="main" key="obtingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">opt-</orth>), <itype>tĭgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tango</etym>. * <sense id="n31973.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>: mustulentus aestus nares obtigit, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 415, 16</bibl>. (The same fragm., <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 64, 2</bibl>, has attigit.)—</sense><sense id="n31973.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall to one's lot</hi> (syn.: accidit, evenit, contingit): naufragio res contigit. Nempe ergo haud Fortuna obtigit, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus est, quoi non invideant rem secundam obtingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies mihi adversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi propter te hoc optigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cuique obtigit, id quisque teneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi obtinget sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi aquaria provincia sorte obtigisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum optatissimum nuntium accepissem, te mihi quaestorem obtigisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 17, 38</bibl>: quam mihi obtigisse dicis <foreign lang="greek">spa)rtan</foreign>, numquam deseram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae hominibus forte obtigerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: quae (vox, latus, etc.) si modica obtigerunt, possunt ratione ampliari, id. praef. § 27.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei (L. Paulo), bellum ut cum rege Perse gereret, obtigisset,</quote> <trans><tr>it had fallen to his lot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31973.2" n="2" level="3"> Of events, <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> (in this sense accidere, contingere, evenire, etc., are more common): eloquere, ut haec res obtigit de filiā, <hi rend="ital">has happened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quom optigerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc tibi ex sententiā tuā obtigisse, laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc confiteor jure Mi obtigisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid obtigerit, aequo animo paratoque moriar,</quote> <trans><tr>if any thing should happen to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoptata obtingent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtinnio: <entryFree id="n31974" type="hapax" key="obtinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n31974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tingle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures illi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 305</bibl></cit>. 6. <cb n="OBTR" /></sense></entryFree>
obtorpeo: <entryFree id="n31975" type="gloss" key="obtorpeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-torpeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n31975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be numb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpet, intorpet, contorpet, obtorpet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtorpesco: <entryFree id="n31976" type="main" key="obtorpesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-torpesco</orth>, <itype>pŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become numb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stiff; to be benumbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose feeling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpedo . . . piscium qui securi supernatantes obtorpuere, corripiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus prae metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:52:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 52, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squamae,</quote> <trans><tr>grow hard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31976.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subactus miseriis obtorpui, Cic. poët. Tusc. 3, 28, 67: circumfuso undique pavore, ita obtorpuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtorpuerunt quodammodo animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtorqueo: <entryFree id="n31977" type="main" key="obtorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31977.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn towards; to turn</hi>: obtorque prorim, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 33</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 575 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">dextrasque obtorquet in undas Proram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:414" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 414</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31977.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writhe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrench</hi> (esp. the neck; rare, and class. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.)</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 66" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtorto collo ad praetorem trahor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dragged violently by the throat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illum collo obtorto ad subsellia reduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 59</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">torquere collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 8</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">obtorta gulā in vincula abripi jussit,</quote> <trans><tr>by the throat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>: obtorto valgiter labello, <hi rend="ital">twisted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contorted</hi>, Petr. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 566, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtorti circulus auri,</quote> <trans><tr>twisted</tr>, <tr>wreathed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 151, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtortio: <entryFree id="n31978" type="hapax" key="obtorti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtorqueo</etym>, <sense id="n31978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a twisting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writhing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distortion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valgia sunt labellorum obtortiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Prisc. Serm. p. 565, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtortus: <entryFree id="n31979" type="main" key="obtortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obtorqueo.</entryFree>
obtractat: <entryFree id="n31980" type="gloss" key="obtractat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtractat</orth>, <itype>contra sententiam tractat</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=187" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 187</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
obtractatio: <entryFree id="n31981" type="main" key="obtracta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtractātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ob-tracto</etym>, <sense id="n31981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the handling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Signif. 31" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Signif. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtraho: <entryFree id="n31982" type="hapax" key="obtra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-trăho</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n31982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn towards</hi>: si tentationibus gradum obtraxerit, Tert, Virg. Vel. 15 dub. (al. obstruxerit).</sense></entryFree>
obtrectatio: <entryFree id="n31983" type="main" key="obtrecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtrectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtrecto</etym>, <sense id="n31983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an envious detracting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparaging; detraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparagement</hi> (class.): obtrectatio est ea, quam intellegi <foreign lang="greek">zhlotupi/an</foreign> volo, aegritudo ex eo, quod alter quoque potiatur eo, quod ipse concupiverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia atque obtrectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 156</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et malevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et invidentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et livor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malevolentissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: malevolorum obtrectationes et invidias prosternere, Vat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31983.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae alienae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtrectator: <entryFree id="n31984" type="main" key="obtrecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtrectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a detractor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traducer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparager</hi> (class.): obtrectator est, qui facit quid contra recte tractantem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=199" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 199</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi communes obtrectatores atque omnium invidi, multa finxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectatores et invidi Scipionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam 1, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non relinquere locum obtrectatorum sermoni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra inimicos atque obtrectatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudum mearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31984.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic sententiae obtrectatores amici regis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtrectatus: <entryFree id="n31985" type="main" key="obtrecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtrectātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for obtrectatio, <sense id="n31985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">detraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparagement</hi> (postclass.): sine vano obtrectatu considerare, an, etc., Gell. praef. § 16.</sense></entryFree>
obtrecto: <entryFree id="n31986" type="main" key="obtrecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-trecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n31986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [tracto], <hi rend="ital">to detract from through envy; to disparage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decry; to be opposed to; to thwart; to injure</hi> a person or thing (class.; syn. detrecto; cf.: aemulo, invideo); constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n31986.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 26, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi, atque causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31986.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (so perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sin livor obtrectare curam voluerit,</quote> <trans><tr>to detract from</tr>, <tr>carp at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2</bibl></cit> epil. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanas excubias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: se invicem,<cb n="OBTU" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31986.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be rivals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectārunt inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31986.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectantis est angi alieno bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectandi causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aut obstare aut obtrectare praesens videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtritio: <entryFree id="n31987" type="main" key="obtri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtero</etym>, <sense id="n31987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contrition</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obtritio cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Divers. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Divers. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtritus: <entryFree id="n31988" type="main" key="obtri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obtero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31989" type="main" key="obtri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obtero</etym>, <sense id="n31989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bruising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crushing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne herbae obtritu hebetentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtrudo: <entryFree id="n31990" type="main" key="obtru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-trūdo</orth> (collat. from <orth extent="full" lang="la">obstrūdo</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n31990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n31990.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">titionem inguinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n31990.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31990.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To gulp down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swallow hastily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrudamus pernam, sumen, glandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 87</bibl></cit>.—In the form obstrudo: <cit><quote lang="la">stans obstrusero aliquid strenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: obstrudant obsatullent, ab avide trudendo ingulam, non sumendo cibum. Unde et obstrudulentum ... dixit Titinius: obstrudulenti aliquid, quod pectam sedens, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=193" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 193</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n31990.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">obtrude upon</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpum alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to wheedle</tr>, <tr>cajole one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma armis, corpora corporibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to dash</tr>, <tr>force against</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactu obtrudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:197" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 197</bibl></cit> (but obstrusa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 4</bibl>, is a false reading for abstrusa).</sense></entryFree>
obtruncatio: <entryFree id="n31991" type="main" key="obtrunca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-truncātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtrunco</etym>, <sense id="n31991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trimming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruning</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">obtruncatio vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtrunco: <entryFree id="n31992" type="main" key="obtrunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-trunco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n31992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lop away; to trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31992.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31992.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: trucido, jugulo, occido): ipsus Amphitruo optruncavit regem Pterelam in proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 259</bibl></cit>: (Medea) puerum interea obtruncat, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl>: ceteri vice pecorum obtruncabantur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedere alios, alios obtruncare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> J. 97, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervos ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 38, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtrusio: <entryFree id="n31993" type="main" key="obtru_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-trūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtrudo</etym>, <sense id="n31993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thrusting in</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpusculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 7 praef" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 7 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:37:197" default="NO">2, 37, 197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtueor: <entryFree id="n31994" type="main" key="obtu^e^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tŭĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype> (archaic <sense id="n31994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> obtuērĭer, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 19</bibl>.—A collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obtŭ-or</orth>, is assumed to explain <hi rend="ital">indic. pres.</hi> obtuĕre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 153</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> obtŭi, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 1</bibl>; Trag. Rel. v. 285 Rib. al.), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31994.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gaze upon</hi> (ante-class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intueor, adspicio): aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 19</bibl>: terram, <hi rend="ital">to look down</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be cast down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31994.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtuitus: <entryFree id="n31995" type="main" key="obtu^i^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtŭĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. obtutus.</entryFree>
obtundo: <entryFree id="n31996" type="main" key="obtundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-tundo</orth>, <itype>tŭdi, tūsum</itype> (and tunsum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31996.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">on</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belabor</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only ante- and post-class.): pectora pugnis, Firm. Math. 5, 5: obtundit os mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>breaks my jaw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obtunso ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam sum obtusus pugnis pessume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31996.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, by striking. </sense><sense id="n31996.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31996.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31996.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 50, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtusus stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to blunt</tr>, <tr>weaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et obtusis ceciderunt viribus artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod tam obtundat elevetque aegritudinem, quam. etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31996.5" n="2" level="3"> Aures or aliquem, or simply obtundere, <hi rend="ital">to stun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">din the ears; to deafen one</hi> by saying a thing too often or too long; hence, <hi rend="ital">to annoy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tease with importunity;</hi> aures graviter obtundo tuas, ne quem ames, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 120</bibl>: ne brevitas<pb n="1248" /> <cb n="OBTU" />  defraudasse aures videatur, neve longitudo obtudisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:221" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 66, 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem longis epistulis,</quote> <trans><tr>to annoy</tr>, <tr>molest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogitando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: obtuderunt ejus aures, te socium praetoris fuisse, <hi rend="ital">they dinned into him that</hi>, etc., Timarch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:67:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 67, § 157</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cessat obtundere, totam prorsus a principio fabulam promeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de aliquā re,</quote> <trans><tr>to importune</tr>, <tr>annoy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtundis, tametsi intellego, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūsus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">obtunsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">optūsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtuse</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n31996.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx obtusa et hebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua lunae obtusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 347</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31996.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi acies obtusior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellis acies obtunsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 395</bibl></cit>: obtusi et hebetes ad aliquam rem, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures obtunsae,</quote> <trans><tr>blunted</tr>, <tr>dull of hearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: vox, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not clear</hi> (opp. clara), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces tumentes strangulant vocem, optusae obscurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>, <tr>spoiled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtunsa pectora,</quote> <trans><tr>insensible</tr>, <tr>without feeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <trans><tr>enfeebled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio ne luxu obtunsior usus Sit genitali arvo,</quote> <trans><tr>too blunted</tr>, <tr>too enfeebled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigor animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <trans><tr>powerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:94" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quid dici potest obtusius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 70</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not keenly</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">crocodili in aquā obtusius vident, in terrā acutissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32, § 28</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc facere obtuse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doct. Christ. 4:5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doct. Christ. 4, 5, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtunsio: <entryFree id="n31997" type="main" key="obtunsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtunsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtundo</etym>, <sense id="n31997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating upon</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">a banging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belaboring</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtunsus: <entryFree id="n31998" type="main" key="obtunsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtunsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obtundo.</entryFree>
obturaculum: <entryFree id="n31999" type="main" key="obtu_ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obturo</etym>, <sense id="n31999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stopple</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obturamentum: <entryFree id="n32000" type="main" key="obtu_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūrāmentum</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">optūrāmen-tum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bung</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:75" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 4, 21, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obturatio: <entryFree id="n32001" type="main" key="obtu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopping up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccles. 27, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obturbatio: <entryFree id="n32002" type="main" key="obturba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obturbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obturbo</etym>, <sense id="n32002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perturbation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. de Principp. 3, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obturbator: <entryFree id="n32003" type="main" key="obturba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obturbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a troubler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturber</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 15:49" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obturbo: <entryFree id="n32004" type="main" key="obturbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make turbid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32004.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obturbata proculcatione prius aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32004.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw into disorder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confusion; to disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eos) denso agmine obturbabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne obturba, ac tace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obturbatur militum vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me scriptio et litterae non leniunt sed obturbant,</quote> <trans><tr>distract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: obturbabant patres specie detestandi, <hi rend="ital">to raise a disturbance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl> (30 Ritter).—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obturbatur, obstrepitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obturgesco: <entryFree id="n32005" type="main" key="obturgesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-turgesco</orth>, <itype>tursi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n32005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to swell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell up</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): obturgescit pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 658</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. bova, p. 30 Müll.: obtursi ebrius, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
obturo: <entryFree id="n32006" type="main" key="obtu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n32006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> obturarier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to close</hi> (class.; syn.: oblino, obstruo). </sense><sense id="n32006.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutturem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 10, 58, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia operculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to refuse to listen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 105</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">obstructas eas partes et obturatas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32006.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem edendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 869</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obtuse: <entryFree id="n32007" type="main" key="obtu_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. obtundo, <sense id="n32007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obtusiangulus: <entryFree id="n32008" type="main" key="obtu_si^angu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūsĭangŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>obtusus-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n32008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having an obtuse angle</hi>: triangulum, Gromat. Vet. p. 378, 17.</sense></entryFree>
obtusio: <entryFree id="n32009" type="main" key="obtu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obtundo</etym>, <sense id="n32009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crushing</hi>, <cb n="OBUS" /> <hi rend="ital">bruising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32009.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bluntness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obtusio sensuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:6:91" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 6, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:4:62" default="NO">1, 4, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obtusus: <entryFree id="n32010" type="main" key="obtu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obtundo.</entryFree>
obtutus: <entryFree id="n32011" type="main" key="obtu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obtūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obtueor</etym>, <sense id="n32011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing (class., but in prose always with oculorum, unless this word is obviously supplied by the context; cf. aspectus): obtutu quasi obtuitu a verbo tuor quod significat video, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=187" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 187</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtutum aliquo figere, id. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 107: dum stupet, obtutuque haeret defixus in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtutu tacito stetit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defixa Latinus Obtutu tenet ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 249</bibl></cit>: oculi in uno obtutu defixi, Sen. de Ira, 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obtutu malorum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the contemplation of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil intecurrens obtutibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 915</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32011.1" n="II" level="1"> (Late Lat.) <hi rend="ital">The eye</hi>: quis ita gemino obtutu eluminatus. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.—More freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita videri nostris obtutibus constitutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi prostrati sub obtutibus ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obultroneus: <entryFree id="n32012" type="gloss" key="o^bultro_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-ultrōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n32012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultroneus, obultroneus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 83</bibl></cit>: ‡ obultroneus, <foreign lang="greek">au)qai/retos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
obumbraculum: <entryFree id="n32013" type="main" key="o^bumbra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbumbrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obumbro</etym>, <sense id="n32013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obscuration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obumbratio: <entryFree id="n32014" type="main" key="o^bumbra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbumbrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkening;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an obscuring</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">allegoricae caecitatis obumbratio, Arn 5, 186: vicissitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obumbratrix: <entryFree id="n32015" type="main" key="o^bumbra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbumbrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that shades</hi> or <hi rend="ital">darkens</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores templi obumbratrices scelerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obumbro: <entryFree id="n32016" type="main" key="o^bumbro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-umbro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overshadow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shade</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: opaco, obscuro). </sense><sense id="n32016.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramineus madidam caespes obumbrat humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma umeros obumbrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:837" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 837</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 20</bibl> Jahn (al. inumbret): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <trans><tr>to shade itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obumbratus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32016.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32016.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obumbrant aethera telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes solem obumbrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 42, 42, § 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32016.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">germina obumbrata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32016.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32016.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overcloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candorem aequitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 5</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia vino obumbratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem amittunt propter id, quod sensus obumbrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 23. —</sense><sense id="n32016.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palliale; to screen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:75" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulationem lacrimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum reginae nomen (eum) obumbrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obuncatus: <entryFree id="n32017" type="main" key="o^bunca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-uncātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n32017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent inward</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obuncatis unguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obunctulus: <entryFree id="n32018" type="hapax" key="o^bunctu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-unctŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n32018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [obunctus]. <hi rend="ital">slightly anointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soiled</hi>: tunica obunctula, with panni fetidi, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 536, 18</bibl>, acc. to Com. Rel. v. 138 Rib. (al., less correctly, obuncula).</sense></entryFree>
obunctus: <entryFree id="n32019" type="main" key="o^bunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-unctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ungo], <sense id="n32019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anointed</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillus guttis Arabicis, obunctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 214, 4</sense></entryFree>
obunculus: <entryFree id="n32020" type="main" key="obuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obuncŭlus</orth>, v. obunctulus.</entryFree>
obuncus: <entryFree id="n32021" type="main" key="o^buncus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-uncus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n32021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hooked</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rostroque immanis vultur obunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obundans: <entryFree id="n32022" type="main" key="o^bundans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-undans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ob-undo], <sense id="n32022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overflowing</hi>: semper obundantes hastas frangit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 435 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
obundatio: <entryFree id="n32023" type="main" key="o^bunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit> dub. (Duker, abundatio.).</sense></entryFree>
obustus: <entryFree id="n32024" type="main" key="o^bustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ob-uro]. <sense id="n32024.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">burnt around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burnt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardened in the fire</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hic torre armatus obusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 894</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32024.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaeba gelu,</quote> <trans><tr>burnt by frost</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 66</bibl></cit>. <cb n="OBVE" /></sense></entryFree>
obvagio: <entryFree id="n32025" type="hapax" key="obva_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vāgĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n32025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whimper about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve esurientes hic, quasi haedi, obvagiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obvagulatum: <entryFree id="n32026" type="main" key="obva_gu^la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvāgŭlātum</orth>, v. obvagulo.</entryFree>
obvagulo: <entryFree id="n32027" type="gloss" key="obva_gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvāgŭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n32027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obvagio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to demand aloud</hi> (lit. with clamor, outcry); in Roman jurid. lang., of the summons addressed to a person to appear as a witness before court: vagulatio in Leg. XII. significat quaestionem cum convicio. Cui testimonium defuerit, is tertiis diebus ob portum (i. e. domum) obvagulatum ito, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. vagulatio, p. 375 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
obvallo: <entryFree id="n32028" type="main" key="obvallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vallo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surround with a wall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rampart; to fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrench.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: urbem, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ob, p. 179 Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n32028.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: locus omni ratione obvallatus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obvaricator: <entryFree id="n32029" type="gloss" key="obva_ri^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvārĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obvaro</etym>: qui cuipiam occurrit, quominus rectum iter conficeret, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 194, 195 Müll.</entryFree>
obvaro: <entryFree id="n32030" type="hapax" key="obva_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vāro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n32030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be opposed to; to cross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thwart</hi>: consiliis obvarant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 22</bibl> (Trag. v. 3 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
obvelo: <entryFree id="n32031" type="main" key="obve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obvenientia: <entryFree id="n32032" type="main" key="obve^ni^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvĕnĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obvenio</etym>, <sense id="n32032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accident</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obvenio: <entryFree id="n32033" type="main" key="obve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n32033.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the way of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> (syn.: obviam venio, occurro; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passage): se in tempore pugnae obventurum,</quote> <trans><tr>would come up to the fight</tr>, <tr>join in the battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 34, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32033.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32033.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall to</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">to fall to one's lot;</hi> usually referring only to what is accidental, as the result of a lot, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syria Scipioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati, quibus hae partes ad defendendum obvenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi obvenit iste labos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aemilio novum bellum in Etruriā sorte obvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui classis obvenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 40, 12</bibl></cit>.—But also in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hereditas ei obvenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 19</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Orell. and B. and K. venisset): si istiusmodi mi fundus hereditate obvenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum obvenisset mihi hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ab re tibi istic obvenit labos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32033.3" n="B" level="2"> Still more gen., like obtingere, of an event, <hi rend="ital">to fall out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to befall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">obvenit occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium (at the auspices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque obvenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obveniens lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:151" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obventicius: <entryFree id="n32034" type="main" key="obventi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obventīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obvenio</etym>, <sense id="n32034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accidental</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adventitious</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obventio: <entryFree id="n32035" type="main" key="obventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">income</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenue</hi>, from rents, etc. (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obventiones et reditūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:7 al" default="NO">7, 1, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
obventus: <entryFree id="n32036" type="main" key="obventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-ventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obverbero: <entryFree id="n32037" type="main" key="obverbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-verbĕro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat soundly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bang</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">asinum baculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 198, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pugnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 221, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">nates (pueri) ferulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 230, 11.</sense></entryFree>
obversio: <entryFree id="n32038" type="main" key="obversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obverto</etym>, <sense id="n32038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius malae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 18, 66, v. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obversor: <entryFree id="n32039" type="main" key="obversor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-versor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n32039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">obverso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">to take position opposite</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose one's self</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32039.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem eorum palam Carthagini obversari dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedebant judices, obversabantur advocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limini,</quote> <trans><tr>who were about the threshold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbe inter coetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32039.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">illius et nomen dulce obversatur ad aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1062" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1062</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ante oculos obversatur rei publicae dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obversentur species honestae viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis, oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in somnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi speciem noctibus obversari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32039.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">malo obniti et obversari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obversus: <entryFree id="n32040" type="main" key="obversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obverto.</entryFree>
obverto: <entryFree id="n32041" type="main" key="obverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-verto</orth>, <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n32041.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To turn</hi> <pb n="1249" /> <cb n="OBVI" /> <hi rend="ital">towards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to direct towards</hi> any thing (not in Cic. or Cæs.): cujus ob os Graii ora obvertebant sua, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl>; also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcūs in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestras in aquilonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago proras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">without pelago: cornua velatarum obvertimus antennarum,</quote> <trans><tr>direct</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 549</bibl></cit>: obstantes dum vult obvertere remos, <hi rend="ital">to turn against</hi> (the water), <hi rend="ital">to play</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 676</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines ad clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32041.1" n="II" level="1"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to turn one's self to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">obvertor ad undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 191</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">obversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turned towards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directed towards.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32041.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciemque obversus in agmen utrumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilia (apium) ad orientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: frons (ornithonis) orienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasus quā soli est obversus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 65</bibl></cit>.—With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obversus orientem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">profligatis obversis,</quote> <trans><tr>the opponents</tr>, <tr>enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32041.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">turned towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sanguinem, et caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obversi militum studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obviam: <entryFree id="n32042" type="main" key="obvi^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vĭam</orth> (also written separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ob vĭam</orth>; cf. Corss. Ausspr. I. 495, 769), <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n32042.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in the way;</hi> hence, with verbs of motion (in a good or bad sense), <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi>: ob Trojam duxit exercitum pro ad, similiterque vadimonium obisse, id est ad vadimonium isse, et obviam ad viam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=147" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 147</bibl> Müll.: morti occumbant obviam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 62</bibl> (Ann. v. 176 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam tam audax fuat homo, qui obviam obsistat mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>as to put himself in my way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in Cumanum mihi obviam venisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: si quā ex parte obviam contra veniretur, <hi rend="ital">an advance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attack should be made</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28</bibl>: alicui obviam advenire, C.
