Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quaero, optime ecce obviam mihi est,</quote> <trans><tr>is coming to meet me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit obviam Clodio ante fundum ejus,</quote> <trans><tr>meets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam ire alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 32, 67</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam procedere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to send to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se offerre,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet</tr>, <tr>to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effundi,</quote> <trans><tr>to pour out to meet</tr>, <tr>to go in great numbers to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de obviam itione ita faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat., also, in obviam: ecce exercitus in obviam illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32042.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sycophantiis, nec fucis ullum mantellum obviam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in comitio estote obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi nulla aegritudo est animo obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amanti mihi tot obviam eveniunt morae,</quote> <trans><tr>present themselves</tr>, <tr>interpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire periculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to meet courageously</tr>, <tr>to encounter them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditati hominum obviam ire,</quote> <trans><tr>to resist</tr>, <tr>oppose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 106</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ire superbiae nobilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire sceleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire fraudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—Also, in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> an evil, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to remedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi> it: <cit><quote lang="la">ni Caesar obviam isset, tribuendo pecunias pro modo detrimenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecunditati terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obvigilo: <entryFree id="n32043" type="hapax" key="obvi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vĭgĭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n32043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to be watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvigilato opust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obvio: <entryFree id="n32044" type="main" key="obvi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n32044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n32044.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:84:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 84, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32044.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32044.3" n="A" level="2"> In a hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae confessioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32044.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obviate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obviolo: <entryFree id="n32045" type="gloss" key="obvi^o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vĭŏlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">OSSA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 996, 13</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 80</bibl> Müll., we now read, more correctly, violavit; v. Müll. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
obvius: <entryFree id="n32046" type="main" key="obvi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ob-via</etym>, <sense id="n32046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so as to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32046.1" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="OBVO" /> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ille obvius ei futurus omnino non erat,</quote> <trans><tr>had no expectation of meeting him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare se obvium alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to meet a person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in loco inter se obvii fuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>had met each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellus insidiarum ab obvio quodam porrectus,</quote> <trans><tr>by one who met him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuicumque est obvia,</quote> <trans><tr>whomsoever she meets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:412" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui mater mediā sese tulit obvia silvā,</quote> <trans><tr>met</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvia cui Camilla Occurrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 498</bibl></cit>: esse in obvio alicui, <hi rend="ital">to be in the way of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">where one can meet another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23</bibl>; so, with <hi rend="ital">ellips.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutidius meus ad Martis fuit obvius aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gravissimis tempestatibus obvium ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen obviorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvii e diverso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aranei tenvia fila Obvia sentimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvias mihi litteras mittas,</quote> <trans><tr>send to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultroque ferebant Obvia securis ubera lactis oves,</quote> <trans><tr>offered</tr>, <tr>presented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: montes, qui obvii erant itineri adversariorum, <hi rend="ital">which lay in their way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which they met</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fell in with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:583" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvia flamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvius undis,</quote> <trans><tr>up the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviaque hospitiis teneat frondentibus arbos,</quote> <trans><tr>over against</tr>, <tr>opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilones,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary</tr>, <tr>adverse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prona cadit lateque et cominus obvia frangens,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing in its way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32046.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32046.3" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, as an enemy, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encounter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ingredienti cum armatā manu obvius fueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurthae obvius procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvii hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestā subit obvius hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 877</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32046.4" n="B" level="2"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n32046.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Easy of access</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">est enim obvius, et expositus, plenusque humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32046.6" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obvious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec se obvias fuisse dicenti, sed conquisitas (figuras),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid venerit obvium loquamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvias opes deferre deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <trans><tr>common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvia et illaborata virtus,</quote> <trans><tr>easy</tr>, <tr>not difficult of attainment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex obvio fere victus (animalibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32046.7" n="3" level="3"> Of words, <hi rend="ital">in constant use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est vestibulum in sermonibus celebre atque obvium verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipes et municipia sunt verba dictu facilia et usu obvia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:10" default="NO">18, 12, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obvium est dicere dimidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32046.8" n="4" level="3"> Se dare obvium, <hi rend="ital">to occur to one's mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">memory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet omnes (versus) praesens memoria non suggerat, tamen, qui se dederint obvios, annotabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32046.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lying open</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obnoxious to</hi> an evil (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rupes Obvia ventorum furiis expostaque ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melioribus opto Auspiciis et quae fuerit minus obvia Graiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvitium quoquoversus obvium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exposed to the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 273 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
obvolito: <entryFree id="n32047" type="main" key="obvo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n32047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flit around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rove about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro obvolitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Porc. Latro</author> Declam. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obvolutatus: <entryFree id="n32048" type="main" key="obvo^lu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-vŏlūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n32048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">entangled</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bos obviis radicibus obvolutatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 4, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obvolutio: <entryFree id="n32049" type="main" key="obvo^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obvolvo</etym>, <sense id="n32049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrapping round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enveloping; an envelope</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetherea obvolutio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 11, § 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:11:79" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 11, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obvolutus: <entryFree id="n32050" type="main" key="obvo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obvŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obvolvo.</entryFree>
obvolvo: <entryFree id="n32051" type="main" key="obvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-volvo</orth>, <itype>vi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n32051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wrap round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muffle up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover all over</hi> (class.; cf. obtego). </sense><sense id="n32051.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor ille vidit, obvolvendum caput Agamemnonis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so freq.: capite obvoluto,</quote> <trans><tr>with his head muffled up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>: caput obnubere ... quod est obvolvere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=170" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 170</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">os obvolutum est folliculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium lanis fasciisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32051.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: fax obvoluta sanguine, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 67</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> v. 85</bibl> Vahl.).—* </sense><sense id="n32051.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbisque decoris Obvolvas vitium,</quote> <trans><tr>cloak</tr>, <tr>disguise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvolutus in peccatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 12, 13</bibl></cit>. <cb n="OCCA" /></sense></entryFree>
occa: <entryFree id="n32052" type="main" key="occa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occo</etym>, <sense id="n32052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harrow</hi> (post-class.); occa rastrum, Gloss. Isid.: occa <foreign lang="greek">bwloko/phma</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occabus: <entryFree id="n32053" type="greek" key="occa^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/kkabos</foreign>, <sense id="n32053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an armlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collar</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">o)/kkabos ta\ peri\ to\n braxi/ona ye/llia</foreign>, Hesych.: OCCABO ET CORONA, Insci Orell. 2263; 2322; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 333</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occaecatio: <entryFree id="n32054" type="hapax" key="occaeca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occaecātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obcaec-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occaeco</etym>, <sense id="n32054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealing</hi>: occatio occaecatio est, Seren. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 61, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occaeco: <entryFree id="n32055" type="main" key="occaeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occaeco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obcaeco</etym>, <sense id="n32055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of sight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32055.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32055.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (only postAug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">excaeco): quidam subito occaecati sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are made blind</tr>, <tr>lose their sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requirendum est, num oculi ejus occaecati sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in occaecatum pulvere effuso hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 43, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32055.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32055.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make dark; to darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem vides, Satin' ut occaecatus est prae hujus corporis candoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densa caligo occaecaverat diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: noctis et nimbūm occaecat nigror, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32055.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (so in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra semen occaecatum cohibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32055.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32055.7" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unintelligible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura narratio totam occaecat orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 329</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32055.8" n="B" level="2"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">to make blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiā occaecatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occaecatus cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid agerent, ira et pavore occaecatis animis, cernebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occaecatus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32055.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To render senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to benumb</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">timor occaecaverat artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occaedes: <entryFree id="n32056" type="spur" key="occaedes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-caedes</orth>, a false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 52</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
occalesco: <entryFree id="n32057" type="main" key="occa^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occălesco</orth>, <itype>lui, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n32057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [ob-calesco], <hi rend="ital">to become warm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occallatus: <entryFree id="n32058" type="hapax" key="occalla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occallātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obcallum</etym>, <sense id="n32058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rendered callous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indurated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occallatae fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occallesco: <entryFree id="n32059" type="main" key="occallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occallesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>lui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n32059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [ob-calleo], <hi rend="ital">to get a thick skin; to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become callous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32059.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera occallescunt plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of one metamorphosed into a swine: <cit><quote lang="la">os sensi occallescere rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 282</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32059.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become callous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam prorsus occallui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā patientiā occallui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mores occalluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occamen: <entryFree id="n32060" type="gloss" key="occa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>occo</etym>, <sense id="n32060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harrowing</hi>: occamen, concisio (sc. glaebarum), Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
occano: <entryFree id="n32061" type="main" key="occa^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-căno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>ui, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, milit., <sense id="n32061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow. sound</hi> a wind instrument (very rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.): cornicines occanuere, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 370</bibl> P. (Hist. 1, 71): <cit><quote lang="la">tum Sentius occanere cornua jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl></cit>; v. occino.</sense></entryFree>
occanto: <entryFree id="n32062" type="main" key="occanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occanto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obcanto</etym>, <sense id="n32062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bewitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier occantata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 327, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occasio: <entryFree id="n32063" type="main" key="occa_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occĭdo, a falling out, a happening, hap; hence</etym>, <sense id="n32063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenient season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable moment</hi> for doing any thing; <foreign lang="greek">eu)kairi/a, kairo/s</foreign> (syn.: opportunitas, locus, facultas). </sense><sense id="n32063.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio est pars temporis, habens in se alicujus rei idoneam faciendi aut non faciendi opportunitatem ... in occasione, ad spatium temporis, faciendi quaedam opportunitas intellegitur adjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:27:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 27, 40</bibl></cit>: tempus actionis opportunum Graece <foreign lang="greek">eu)kairi/a</foreign>, Latine appellatur occasio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl>: occasio opportunitas temporis casu quodam provenientis est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum datur mihi occasio Tempusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc occasio est et tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ego occasionem tantam, tam brevem, tam optatam, tam insperatam Amitterem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit> infra: occasionem nancisci, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 308, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem, si interficere voluisset, quantae quoties occasiones, quam praeclarae fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio opprimendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inrumpendi in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: majores occasiones ad opitulandum haberem, <hi rend="ital">more opportunities</hi>, Planc <pb n="1250" /> <cb n="OCCA" /> up. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum occasio data est rem publicam defendendi,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as an opportunity presented itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem sibi ad occupandam Asiam oblatam esse arbitratur,</quote> <trans><tr>has presented itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplam occasionem calumniae nactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio mirifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo faciliorem occasionem Salvio praebuit perficiendi conata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio minor opinione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:25" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to lose</tr>, <tr>let slip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to seize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasiones quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapere de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasione uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deesse occasioni,</quote> <trans><tr>not to miss</tr>, <tr>to profit by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctationem hostium suam fore occasionem rati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum datur mihi occasio tempusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne a fortunā datam occasionem liberandae Graeciae dimitterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alc. 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (rei) se occasio dederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: (paratus) depugnare, si occasio tulerit, mori, si casus inciderit, etc., Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem aperire ad invadendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem sibi ad occupandam Asiam oblatam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasione datā,</quote> <trans><tr>should an opportunity offer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">occasione oblatā simultates deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per occasionem,</quote> <trans><tr>on a favorable opportunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem inmaturam nisi per occasionem aperire noluerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 53, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris memoriā per omnem occasionem celebratā,</quote> <trans><tr>on every occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad occasionem aurae evehi,</quote> <trans><tr>the wind being fair</tr>, <tr>taking advantage of a fair wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia proelia ex occasione hujus aut illius partis oriebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex occasione,</quote> <trans><tr>as occasion offered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasione omni,</quote> <trans><tr>on every occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc adest occasio Benefacta cumulare = occasio cumulandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc est illa occasio inimicum ulcisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere tuam rem occasio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 60</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summa eludendi occasio'st mihi nunc senes Et Phaedriae curam adimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit occasio, si vellet, jam pridem argentum ut daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam occasio fuit Mea virtute parta ut quantum velles sumeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara haec occasio est, ut referri possint divini honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32063.2" n="B" level="2"> Personified: Occasio, <hi rend="ital">Opportunity</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32063.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32063.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Opportunity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32063.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Facility</hi> or <hi rend="ital">means of having</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32063.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetusti olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32063.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plausible explanation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hāc illi opus est occasione, ne illum talium precum pudeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasiones et ex causis et ex dictis adversariorum oriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:13" default="NO">12, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulacunque adeo est occasio, sufficit irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:183" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32063.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habeo ullam occasionem, ut apud te falsa fabuler,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32063.9" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surprise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionis esse rem, non proelii,</quote> <trans><tr>they were undertaking a surprise</tr>, <tr>not a battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (belli) maxima momenta in occasionibus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionibus imminere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:22" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32063.10" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cause</hi> (late Lat.): cum calcis ictu mortis occasio praebita videatur, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 1, 10, 1.</sense></entryFree>
occasionaliter: <entryFree id="n32064" type="main" key="occa_si^o_na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāsĭōnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>occasio</etym>, <sense id="n32064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as occasions arise</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occasiuncula: <entryFree id="n32065" type="main" key="occa_si^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāsĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis argute me obrepsisti in eāpse occasiunculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 132</bibl></cit>; Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 7, 21, v. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occasivus: <entryFree id="n32066" type="gloss" key="occa_si_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāsīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. occasus</etym>, <sense id="n32066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to setting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">going down</hi>: occasivus <foreign lang="greek">dutiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
occasus: <entryFree id="n32067" type="main" key="occa_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from occĭdo. <cb n="OCCE" /></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32068" type="main" key="occa_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occāsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>occĭdo</etym>. <sense id="n32068.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A falling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going down</hi> (class.; cf. obitus). </sense><sense id="n32068.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting</hi>, of the heavenly bodies; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of the sun: ante occasum Maiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus occasusque signorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the rising and setting of the constellations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipiti in occasum die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32068.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the quarter of the heavens in which the sun sets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the west</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter occasum solis et septentriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ortu ad occasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager Longus in occasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de terrā occasus solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32068.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">downfall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post obitum occasumque vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasus interitusque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliaci cineres et flamma extrema meorum, Testor, in occasu vestro, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 432</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post L. Aelii nostri occasum,</quote> <trans><tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n32068.4" n="II" level="1"> For occasio, <hi rend="ital">an occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi>, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 164; 171; 292 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
occatio: <entryFree id="n32069" type="main" key="occa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occo</etym>, <sense id="n32069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harrowing</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra semen occaecatum cohibet: ex quo occatio, quae hoc efficit, nominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:62" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occator: <entryFree id="n32070" type="main" key="occa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harrower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>; cf.: occatorem Verrius putat dictum ab occaedendo quod caedat grandis globos terrae, cum Cicero venustissime dicat ab occaecando fruges satas, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sator sartorque scelerum, et messor maxume. <hi rend="ital">Ty.</hi> Non occatorem prius audebas dicere? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32070.1" n="II" level="1"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the Roman god who prospered the harrower's work</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occatorius: <entryFree id="n32071" type="main" key="occa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>occator</etym>, <sense id="n32071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a harrower; of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for harrowing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occecurri: <entryFree id="n32072" type="main" key="occe^curri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĕcurri</orth>, v. occurro <sense id="n32072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
occedo: <entryFree id="n32073" type="main" key="occe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occēdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">obc-; occīdo</orth>, <sense id="n32073.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>essi, essum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-cedo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to go towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go up to</hi> one (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectum alicujus occedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17</bibl>. —In the collat. form occīdo: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nos occidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 10</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: occidamus Plautus ponit pro contra cedamus, cum plurimae aliae praepositiones familiares huic verbo sint, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
occelo: <entryFree id="n32074" type="main" key="occe_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occēlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-celo</etym>, <sense id="n32074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conceal</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Rusp. ad Monim. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
occensus: <entryFree id="n32075" type="hapax" key="occensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [obcandeo], <sense id="n32075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burnt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burnt up</hi>: omnes occisi obcensique in nocte serenā, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ob, p. 201 Müll. (Ann. v. 388 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
occentatio: <entryFree id="n32076" type="main" key="occenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occento</etym>, <sense id="n32076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braying</hi> (post-class.): bucinarum, Symm. Or. ap. Valent. 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
occento: <entryFree id="n32077" type="main" key="occento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occento</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obcanto</etym>, <sense id="n32077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n32077.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To serenade</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 66</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, si adeam ad fores atque occentem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymenaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. offundam).—</sense><sense id="n32077.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to sing a satirical song</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pasquinade</hi> against any one (class.): occentassint antiqui dicebant, quod nunc convicium fecerint dicimus: quod id clare, et cum quodam canore fit, ut procul exaudiri possit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.: si quis occentavisset, sive carmen condidisset, quod infamiam faceret flagitiumve alteri, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:10:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 10, 12</bibl> (Fragm. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 9); cf. Rein's Criminalrecht, p. 357 sq.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the place</hi>: ostium, <hi rend="ital">to sing a lampoon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pasquinade before one's door</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32077.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of birds of ill omen: <cit><quote lang="la">bubo occentans funebria,</quote> <trans><tr>singing dismal songs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occentus: <entryFree id="n32078" type="main" key="occentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>occino</etym>, <sense id="n32078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cry</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">soricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occepso: <entryFree id="n32079" type="main" key="occepso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occepso</orth>, v. occipio <sense id="n32079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
occepto: <entryFree id="n32080" type="main" key="occepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n32080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> occeptassit; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>occipio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi> (Plautin.): occeptat insanire, Plaut. <cb n="OCCI" /> Men. 5, 5, 18 and 32.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si attigerit sive occeptassit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occhi: <entryFree id="n32081" type="main" key="occhi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occhi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tree in Hyrcania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling the fig-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which honey flowed in the morning</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the manna sainfoin</hi>, Hedysarum Alhagi of Linn., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 8, 18, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occia: <entryFree id="n32082" type="main" key="Occi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Occĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Vestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occidaneus: <entryFree id="n32083" type="main" key="occi^da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>occidens</etym>, <sense id="n32083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the west</hi>, <hi rend="ital">western</hi>, <hi rend="ital">west-</hi> (postclass.): ventus, Innocent. Cas. Litter. p. 228 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
occidens: <entryFree id="n32084" type="main" key="occi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. occĭdo.</entryFree>
occidentalis: <entryFree id="n32085" type="main" key="occi^denta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>occidens</etym>, <sense id="n32085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">western</hi>, <hi rend="ital">westerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">west-</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab occidentali latere septentrionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:42:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 42, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occidio: <entryFree id="n32086" type="main" key="occi_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīdĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. occīdo</etym>, <sense id="n32086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a massacre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extermination</hi> (rare before the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: clades, strages, caedes): orare ne in occidione victoriam poneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. in the phrase occidione occidere or caedere, <hi rend="ital">to cut off completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut down with utter destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus occidione occisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes occidione caesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:1" default="NO">28, 2, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">occidione occumbere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wholly cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi, viri, cuncta victa occidioni dantur,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing captured was destroyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidioni exempti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 56</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of animals and plants: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ad occidionem gens interimenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidionem gregis prohibens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ad occidionem universum genus perduci patimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occidium: <entryFree id="n32087" type="main" key="occi_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">occidium sentit jam jamque futurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 695</bibl></cit> (al. excidium).</sense></entryFree>
occido: <entryFree id="n32088" type="main" key="occi_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype> (occisit for occiderit, Lex Num. Pompil. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. occisum. pp. 178 and 179; also Lex XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n32088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike to the ground; to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32088.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32088.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occare id est comminuere, ne sit glaeba: quod ita occidunt, occare dictum,</quote> <trans><tr>to crush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occisum ad mortem,</quote> <trans><tr>wounded to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32088.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut down; to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi> (class. and very freq.; syn.: interficio, trucido, obtrunco): summus ibi capitur meddix: occiditur alter, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 296 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">L. Virginius filiam suā manu occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse pro castris fortissime pugnans occiditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: occidione occidere, <hi rend="ital">to completely cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy;</hi> v. occidio: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unum omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut off all to the last man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veneno,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy with poison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occisus videtur non tantum qui per vim aut per caedem interfectus est, velut jugulatus ... sed et is qui veneno Necatus dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et occidet eum lingua viperae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 20, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occisa sunt in terrae motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedistine ei gladium qui se occideret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: cum ipse se conaretur occidere, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 69</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 18, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">occidit, adversariumne? immo vero aiunt se et eum, quem defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 302</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32088.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32088.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To plague to death; to torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pester</hi> (cf. exanimo, II. B.; very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): occidis me, cum istuc rogitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā occidis fabulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidis saepe rogando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 475</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32088.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidisti me tuis fallaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-cīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undone</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">occisa est haec res, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occisissimus sum omnium, qui vivunt,</quote> <trans><tr>I am the most unfortunate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32089" type="main" key="occi^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, cāsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>obcado</etym>, <sense id="n32089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32089.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">et alia Signa de caelo ad terram occidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 8</bibl></cit>: ut alii <pb n="1251" /> <cb n="OCCI" /> super alios occiderent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ita inciderant, ut momento levi impulsae occiderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32089.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32089.4" n="1" level="3"> Of the heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">to go down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> (class.): prope jam occidente sole, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles occidere, et redire possunt: Nobis, cum semel occidit brevis lux, Nox est perpetua una dormienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capra, Aquila, Canicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:94" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasura pars caeli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>western</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 92</bibl></cit>: SOL OCCASVS SVPREMA TEMPESTAS ESTO, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sundown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunset</hi>, Lex XII. Tab.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 10</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 5</bibl> Müll., gives, instead of it, OCCASVS SOLIS; v. 2. occasus); so, <cit><quote lang="la">ante solem obcasum,</quote> <trans><tr>before sunset</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec lux occidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 158</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">non occidet ultra sol tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:60:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 60, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32089.5" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: obeo, pereo, intereo): exstincto calore, occidimus ipsi et extinguimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eudemus proelians ad Syracusas occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperans hostium saevitiā facile eum occasurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiderit ferro Priamus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 581</bibl></cit>: dextrā suā, <hi rend="ital">to die by one's own hand</hi> (by suicide), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 659</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimo vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32089.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be ruined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lost</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n32089.7" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">sin plane occidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—So, esp., occidi, an exclamation of despair, <hi rend="ital">I am lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla sum, nulla sum: tota tota occidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidimus funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 413</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32089.8" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle occiderunt mihi etiam fundique atque aedes,</quote> <trans><tr>I have not yet lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidit spes nostra,</quote> <trans><tr>is gone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen (oculorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:30:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidit ornatus (mundi),</quote> <trans><tr>perishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra beneficia occasura esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the quarter of the setting sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the west</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the occident</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab oriente ad occidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel occidentis usque ad ultimum sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui se oriens occidensque submiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validissima in se civium arma viribus occidentis coepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: partes mundi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=339" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 339</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
